wikipedia_page.main: Frederick William Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol PC, FSA (15 July 1800 – 30 October 1864), styled Lord Hervey from 1803 to 1826 and Earl Jermyn from 1826 to 1859, was a British Tory politician. He served as Treasurer of the Household under Sir Robert Peel between 1841 and 1846.

response: *Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol (15 July 1800 – 30 October 1864), the great-great-grandfather of the present Marquess

link_mentions.page: List of women who died in childbirth
response: *Lady Katherine Manners (1848), wife of Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol (she also died of smallpox)
*Lady Katherine Isabella Manners (4 February 1809 – 20 April 1848), married Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol on 1 December 1830. They had seven children.

Hervey was the fourth and youngest son of Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol and his wife Lady Katherine Isabella Manners, fourth daughter of John Manners, 5th Duke of Rutland. His older brothers were Frederick Hervey, 3rd Marquess of Bristol and Lord Augustus Hervey. He was educated at Eton College, where he won the Newcastle Scholarship,The Educational Times (vol.18, New Series, No.50), at page 35 and later Balliol College, Oxford, where he graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in 1869. Hervey was called to the bar by Lincoln's Inn in 1872 and was nominated  an Honorary Fellow of Hertford College, Oxford two years later.

link_mentions.page: Frederick William Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol

response: Hervey was the second son of Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol, and Lady Katherine Isabella, daughter of John Manners, 5th Duke of Rutland. Frederick Hervey, 3rd Marquess of Bristol and Lord Francis Hervey were his brothers.

response: *Lady Katherine Isabella Manners (4 February 1809 – 20 April 1848), who married Frederick Hervey, 2nd Marquess of Bristol, and had seven children.
